Contributor: Morgan, R. G., artist.; Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Signed "R.G. Morgan." Date based on the date of the Fourth Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for newspaper and magazine advertisement for the Fourth Liberty Loan campaign. The text says that the higher you go in buying Liberty bonds, the more blows and bombs will go to smash into the heart of Germany. Illustration shows an aviator, who points at the viewer.  A Curtiss JN-4D "Jenny" flies in the background.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.

Title: How high will you go?
